abstract: Pennsylvania Gov Tom Wolf rejects parts of $30.3 billion budget plan proposed by Republican legislators using line-item veto authority, but releases money for schools, social services and county governments; it is first time Wolf has used veto authority since taking office in January.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Tom Wolf of Pennsylvania scolded Republican legislators as he rejected parts of a $30.3 billion budget plan but released money for schools and county governments that had been stuck in a stalemate.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Governor Vetoes Parts of Budget
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Governor Vetoes Parts of Budget

snippet: Gov. Tom Wolf of Pennsylvania scolded Republican legislators as he rejected parts of a $30.3 billion budget plan but released money for schools and county governments that had been stuck in a stalemate.
